availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James B. Lyne (Henderson County, Kentucky, resident and assistant clerk of the Kentucky House of Representatives)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, attorney and officeholder. Tennessee native. Son of Mary C. Lyne. Married to Mary A. Hopkins Lyne on April 24, 1860. Father of James Lyne. Married to Caroline Lyne. Father of Catharine Johnson Lyne. Resident of Henderson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in 1850. Attended Shelby College in Shelby County, Kentucky, 1852-1853. Resident of Henderson County in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in 1860. Elected as the Assistant Clerk of the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1861. Attorney in Henderson County in 1863.
